intro: Osteospermum muricatum subsp. muricatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. The plant has a compact growth habit and produces numerous blooms throughout the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
